job_title: Registered Nurse in Carbondale, IL
pros: Best doctors to work for, great nurses to work with and lots of great benefits
cons: Short staffed at times especially during illness season

review_title: terrible pay for a lot of work
job_title: CMA I in Carterville, IL
pros: No longer being employed by this company is the only pro
cons: Too many to list. Upper management, lower management. Middle to old age post menopausal women who talk about everyone behind their backs while each one feeds their secret addictions and lives

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Carbondale, IL
pros:
Good hours
Great co workers
Good opportunity
cons:
Management
Patients
Hours for doctors appointments are rough

job_title: Dlh Holdings in Chelmsford, MA
pros: good pay and no need fore socializing
cons: Was a long distance from home

job_title: Health Center Manager in Carbondale, IL
pros: Co Workers and the satisfaction from helping others
cons: Nothing that I can think of

job_title: Registered Nurse in Carbondale, IL
pros: most of my coworkers have become good friends.
cons: My opinion is never taken into account, and the political hierarchy at carbondale really makes the day go by so slow

job_title: Registered Nurse in Carbondale, IL
pros: made a couple good friends there
cons: the nursing leadership at carbondale is lacking

review_title: Luck of the draw. Supervisor matters.
job_title: Clinical Case Manager in Carbondale, IL
pros: Great clinical staff, professional treatment for your expertise,
cons: Management is out of touch with the clinical front lines. Very demanding of changes from above with little regard for impact on service. I was responsible for things for which i was given no guidelines and chastised for not following unwritten rules. Personal supervisor will make you or break you.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Carbondale, IL
pros: No weekends, paid holidays. It’s. A Non profit that helps out the community. They also have a sliding fee for people with no insurance and an emergency fund.
cons: Short staffed frequently and low base pay. Not very LGBTQ friendly. Have overheard multiple times extremely discriminatory comments from management on religion, race and gender.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Murphysboro, IL
pros: They always seem to be hiring. Several offices in Southern Illinois.
cons: Very disrespectful and under qualified staff. Upper management caters to doctor's every need with little regard to patients. Some employees are able to do whatever they please in front of management yet others get reprimanded when they do the same in front of the same person.
